posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Templar wrote:unavailable sadly
Then you are going to need to define the specific environment since it is not a vanilla one. There is no "magical" recipe and it requires the build user to be comfortable with the combat strategy or even the most "uber" build will fail miserably.

I would expect, though, that some sort of high level STR monk spamming IKD would cause some major problems along with high saves, high SR, & all the other typical monk boni. At least it wouldn't need to be concerned with damage shields or Time Stop. Or are you talking about something other than a pure cleric?

Clerics come in all sorts of flavors so you would probably need to design one to counter a specific cleric build. Harmer, Battle Priest, Blade Spawner, Imploder... there are too many different approaches to playing cleric to expect a one-size-fits-all counter. Then chuck the countless customizations available (like DevCrit bans!) into the mix and the design would need to deal with all those potentialities.

When I use to duel regularly I always built to win against a single build. When they showed up with a variant, I would usually bring a slightly modified version.

I also do not know what you mean by "no surprize factor". Wuts dat? Walk twenty paces, turn and attack?

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
HipMaestro wrote:
I would expect, though, that some sort of high level STR monk spamming IKD would cause some major problems along with high saves, high SR, & all the other typical monk boni. At least it wouldn't need to be concerned with damage shields or Time Stop.

Not that it would be a given but this probably gives you the best chance.

Assuming a lev 30 world like Arelith, a pure cleric can beat an SR of 50, 56 with the penetration feats. A lev 30 monk has a base SR of 40 and can take up to 6 Improved Spell Resistance feats. This gets you up to an SR of 52, so you're fine if you're not fighting a pure caster cleric (SR wise, you could drop 1 Improved Spell Resis and grab Epic Weapon Focus if you want to risk 5% of spells getting through). Against a pure caster, he/she will have a 25% getting spells through so hope those IKD's land quick.

Another anti-cleric option is the Arcane Archer. Something like a Fighter 5 / Bard 6 / AA 19 or Monk 6 / Wiz 5 / AA 19 (not sure of the optimal 30 level spread, but AA 19 gives you the last available AB bonus) with Rapid Shot, Called Shot, 14d6 imbue arrow damage (clerics aren't known for their reflex save). The Fighter option gives you WS/EWS while the Monk version can get you faster movement, free IKD and WIS AC bonus.

I'm sure there are other options as well.

EDIT: Corrected SR penetration numbers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Templar wrote:so ... i was thinking, cleric is usually the recognized power build without doing much to it. typically the same for mages...
I believe you answer your own question. You can beat a caster cleric with a better caster and a buffer cleric with a debuffer. The arcane spell repertoire has what it takes to kill most things, also clerics. First of all, never leave home without your buffs up. Use Breach/Mord and Bigby to debuff and stop, IGMS to wear down HPs and haste/TS to buy you enough time. Against an "econo cleric" meleer you can also try the shapechange/damage shield combo, preferably after dispelling him. GS/BBOD will work as long as you are undispellable and your opponent forgot to memorize dismissal. Against a counterspeller, a hasted sorcerer can pour out spells at a high rate and will either outpace or outlast a cleric of equal level.

posts.author: Hafen
posts.content:
I have got cleric 19/5 fighter/2 rogue and i can said, my AC is equal to the warriors AB only with vestment which cannot be dispelled. (IC 42 AC which i cannot loose by spell breach or dispel spells).
Fully buffed (but not hasted) her AC is 46, ab 40-43.

She can use scrolls and wands. Without dispel most meleers cannot almost touch her, do not forget I can dispel you too, and then just one spell and you die (harm). The only issue with meleers are timestop scrolls or random critical on natural 20 passing through AC and 50% conceal....

The biggest problem i encoutered are AA, who are faster than my character. They usually shot her without much troubles no matter what spells I put up. But, i met these pesky archers only in the area with brigdes (vault for Templar he will know) where they could run all around on narrow path and shoot from two or three screens away.

The nemesis are wizards. Maximized IGM, timestop, Great ruin/hell ball, IGM to finish off. If cleric survives, just add IGM before can cast heal spell.

Cleric versus cleric: spell breach scrolls and wands are neccesary. The fastest way to kill anyone is to remove negative protection, harm, and poke it.

Perhaps barbarian fear shout could work well, but i have never encoutered it.

That said, I am newbie in pvp and my character is not fully optimized, many errors and such i did in past and lack top gear. But i manage to win if not outnumbered for now (the fact i buffed myself and just watch most meleers trying to hit me without any success leaves me no mood to play meleer ).

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Just too general a question to serve up any viable all-encompassing answer. On some high-magic servers, cleric levels are wasted when ability and skill caps can easily be met and immunities to divine spells abound. Typically, any class that is able to use a standard non-nerfed Timestop via class or UMD and wins the first casting will always win a duel for what should be obvious reasons. But vs. seriously save/SR-twinked monsters, any casting class is futile.

The answer MUST be tempered according to what items are available on the server, even for PvP. In general, AA's can hit just about anything and with enhanced arrows can cause havoc from screens away, well out of casting range. And there are a handful of DevCrit AA's out there that do not need to be concerned about damage.
